alert.note: Alert for Central Middlesex County; Eastern Norfolk; Northern Bristol; Southern Worcester; Suffolk; Western Norfolk (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 2:26PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Norfolk, southwestern Suffolk, southeastern Worcester, south central Middlesex and northern Bristol Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 226 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Sherborn, or near Natick, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. Heavy Rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Heavy rain may cause urban and poor drainage flooding in localized downpours. Locations impacted include... Boston, Framingham, Natick, Randolph, Franklin, Needham, Norwood, Milford, Wellesley, Milton, Stoughton, Dedham, Walpole, Easton, Canton, Sharon, Foxborough, Ashland, Bellingham and Hopkinton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle. This storm may intensify and become severe. Stay tuned to your local media for updates and possible warnings.

area.areaDesc: Central Middlesex County; Eastern Norfolk; Northern Bristol; Southern Worcester; Suffolk; Western Norfolk
